meanings.sent1: She was prevaluing the handmade gift from her friend.
meanings.sent2: He always prevalued honesty in his relationships.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be prevaluing the empty box more than the expensive toy.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, the old photograph prevalued all other possessions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's kind words prevalued the student's confidence.

meanings.definition: To hold a higher value or importance than something else
meanings.sent1: The safety of the children prevalued any other concerns for the parents.
meanings.sent2: His family always prevalued spending time together over material possessions.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream truck's arrival prevalued all other sounds in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The memory of her grandmother's advice prevalued any other advice she received.
meanings.sent5: The rare flower in the garden prevalued all other plants with its beauty.

meanings.definition: To be in a position of greater influence or power
meanings.sent1: The queen prevalued over all other rulers in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The CEO prevalued in the decision-making process of the company.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape seemed to be prevaluing over the rest of the costume.
meanings.sent4: The captain of the team prevalued in motivating the players to perform their best.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl prevalued as the leader of the forest animals.
